qas.question: What year did the end of Imperial China occur?
How long did Imperial China last for?

context: On 12 February <a0_0>1912<a0_0/>, after rounds of negotiations, Longyu issued an imperial edict bringing about the abdication of the child emperor Puyi. This brought an end to over <a1_0>2,000 years<a1_0/> of Imperial China and began an extended period of instability of warlord factionalism. The unorganized political and economic systems combined with a widespread criticism of Chinese culture led to questioning and doubt about the future. In the 1930s, the Empire of Japan invaded Northeast China and founded Manchukuo in <a2_0>1932<a2_0/>, with Puyi, as the emperor. After the invasion by the Soviet Union, Manchukuo collapsed in 1945.
